content:
EXISTING STRUCTURES
────────────────────
### Copper Cable Factory at (2.5, 17.5)
Consists of the following entities:
– Cable factory input chest at (2.5, 17.5)
– Factory burner inserter (placed with direction RIGHT) at (3.5, 17.5)
 • Connected with a secondary burner inserter at (2.5, 16.5)
 • Neighbouring assembling machine at (1.5, 19.5)

### Belt Depot System at (3.5, 15.5)
Consists of the following entities:
– Wooden chest placed as belt depot at (3.5, 15.5)
– Transport belt segment placed adjacent to the chest at (4.5, 15.5)
– Depot burner inserter (placed with direction UP) at (3.5, 14.5) using the chest’s pickup position as target

ERROR TIPS
──────────
• Belt connection target error:
  Repeated errors report that transport belts cannot be connected directly to a Prototype.SteamEngine. To avoid this, always place an inserter to serve as the target for belt connections.
  
• Placement distance error:
  An error occurred when attempting to place a wooden chest at (3.5, 15.5) because the target was too far from the player’s position. Ensure you move closer to the intended placement position to satisfy the maximum distance requirement.
  
• Inventory availability error:
  A placement failure due to “No wooden_chest in inventory” indicates the required entity was missing. Verify that the necessary items are available in your inventory before attempting placement.
  
• Undefined variable error:
  An error citing “target_chest is not defined” suggests a reference to a variable that wasn’t initialized. Confirm that all variable names are defined correctly before use.
